definitions.definition: a piece of thread sewn in cloth, or the single movement of a needle and thread into and out of the cloth that produces this:
examples: Secure the two pieces together with a couple of stitches.

definitions.definition: one of the small circles of wool that you make when you are knitting:
examples: He cast on/off a stitch (= added/removed a length of thread from the needle).

definitions.definition: a particular type of stitch made in sewing or knitting, or the pattern that this produces:
a length of special thread used to join the edges of a deep cut in the flesh:

examples: I don't have a stitch to wear (= I do not have anything suitable to wear) for this party tonight.

definitions.definition: to sew two things together, or to repair something by sewing:
examples: This button needs to be stitched back onto my shirt.

definitions.definition: to make a piece of clothing:
examples: I must discard these old shirts and stitch some before next summer.
